The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are followed by elongated, woody fruits. Tournefortia nitida is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has also been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
